front.title: Signaling MSD (Maximum SID Depth) using OSPF

abstract.t: This document defines a way for an Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Router to advertise multiple types of supported Maximum SID Depths (MSDs) at node and/or link granularity. Such advertisements allow entities (e.g., centralized controllers) to determine whether a particular SID stack can be supported in a given network. This document defines only one type of MSD, but defines an encoding that can support other MSD types. Here the term OSPF means both OSPFv2 and OSPFv3.
